page.title: 01HITCHIN - An Overview
page.content: Hitchin (pop approx 30,000) is situated in a pleasant rural setting in NW Herts,close to the Beds border and 35m from London. This historical market town is believed to take its name from the{HICCE TRIBE.}The manor of Hitchin is recorded in the Domesday Book of 1086 as a royal possession, but its history dates back at least to another 300 yrs.Hitchin is indeed a good example of the blending of the old and the new,with half_timbered buildings,coaching inns,period houses, neat new housing estates and a good shopping centre and market. It's industries are well established which include leather,printing and horti_ cultural industries,flour mills and a large dairy.The town has a museum/art gallery,swimming pool and many churches and pubs,the latter of which at one time numbered more than 200.
